title: One, two, three, four, song
lyrics:
One, two three, four
Anastasia at the door
Kissing Gabbie at the gate,
Five, six, seven, eight.

title: Twenty, eighteen, song
lyrics:
Twenty, eighteen, sixteen, fourteen,
Twelve, ten, eight, six, four, two, none,
Nineteen, seventeen, fifteen and thirteen,
Eleven, nine, seven, five, three and one.

title: The rippo, the rappo, song
lyrics:
The rippo, the rappo, the sailor's on the sea,
Me oh, my oh, they're after me.
Are you coming to the fair?
I went, she went, there's no fair there.
I must not miss a loopie-oh.

title: Bluebells, cockleshells, rhyme
lyrics:
Bluebells, cockle-shells,
Eever, iver, over.

title: Skip, skip, skip to my Lou, song
lyrics:
Skip, skip, skip to maloo,
Skip, skip, skip to maloo,
Skip, skip, skip to maloo,
Skip to maloo, my darling.

title: My name is L I L I, song
lyrics:
My name is L - I - L - I
Chickalie, chickalie,
Walla waller winker,
Chinese chopsticks,
Indian chief.

title: Dusty bluebells, song
lyrics:
In and out goes the dusty bluebells,
In and out goes the dusty bluebells,
In and out goes the dusty bluebells,
You are the master.
Tapper-rapper-rapper on your shoulders,
Tapper-rapper-rapper on your shoulders,
Tapper-rapper-rapper on your shoulders,
You are the master.

title: A big ship sailed to the illy ally oh, song
lyrics:
A big ship sails to the illy ally oh,
The illy ally oh, the illy ally oh,
A big ship sails to the illy ally oh,
On the last day of September.

title: Wallflowers, song
lyrics:
Wallflowers, wallflowers, growing up so high,
Especially Marie, she is the youngest child.
Oh fie, for shame, oh fie, for shame,
Turn your back against the game.
Wallflowers, wallflowers, growing up so high,
Especially Deborah, she is the youngest child.
Oh fie, for shame, oh fie, for shame,
Turn your back against the game.

title: A little thing goes wandering about, song
lyrics:
A little thing goes wandering about
Behind her backs and under her tracks.
See, I have got it,
See, I have got it,
Tra-la, la-la, la-la.

title: Thart fá dtaobh den bhaile, song
lyrics:
Thart fá dtaobh den bhaile,
Thart fá dtaobh den bhaile,
Thart fá dtaobh den bhaile,
Mar rinneamar fadó.
Amach 's isteach ar fhuinneog,
Amach 's isteach ar fhuinneog,
Amach 's isteach ar fhuinneog,
Mar rinneamar fadó.

title: Green gravel, song
lyrics:
Green gravel, green gravel, the grass is so green
And her face is the fairest that ever was seen.
I'll wash her in buttermilk and I'll dress her in silk
And I'll write her a letter with a gold pen and ink.

title: Old Roger is dead, song
lyrics:
Old Roger is dead and he lies in his grave,
Lies in his grave, lies in his grave,
Old Roger is dead and he lies in his grave,
Y - O - U.
There grew an old apple tree over his head,
Over his head, over his head,
There grew an old apple tree over his head,
Y - O - U.
The apples got ripe and they all fell off,
All fell off, all fell off,
The apples got ripe and they all fell off,
Y - O - U.
There came an old woman picking them up,
Picking them up, picking them up,
There came an old woman picking them up,
Y - O - U.
Old Roger got up and he hit her a kick,
Hit her a kick, hit her a kick,
Old Roger got up and he hit her a kick,
Y - O - U.
Then the old woman went hippety-hop,
Hippety-hop, hippety-hop,
Then the old woman went hippety-hop,
Y - O - U.
Old Roger got up and he helped her to walk,
Helped her to walk, helped her to walk,
Old Roger got up and he helped her to walk,
Y - O - U.

title: Cups and saucers, song
lyrics: Cups and saucers, plates and dishes, Little black men in calico britches. Open your gates and let me through.

title: There came three gipsies riding, song
lyrics:
There came three gipsies riding,
Riding, riding,
There came three gipsies riding,
Y - O - U.
What are you riding here for,
Here for, here for?
What are you riding here for?
Y - O - U.
We're riding here to marry one of you boys
You boys, you boys,
We're riding here to marry one of you boys
Y - O - U.
Who would marry you boys?
You boys, you boys?
Who would marry you boys
Y - O - U.
We're just as good as you boys,
You boys, you boys,
We're just as good as you boys
Y - O - U.
Your knees are stiff as pokers,
Pokers, pokers,
Your knees are stiff as pokers
Y - O - U.
We can bend our knees as well as you boys,
You boys, you boys,
We can bend our knees as well as you boys
Y - O - U.
Where will your mother sleep?,
Your mother sleep, your mother sleep?
Where will your mother sleep?
Y - O - U.
Her mother will sleep in her father's bed,
Her father's bed, her father's bed,
Her mother will sleep in her father's bed
Y - O - U.
Where will your father sleep?,
Father sleep, father sleep?
Where will your father sleep?
Y - O - U.
Her father will sleep in the maid's bed,
the maid's bed, the maid's bed,
Her father will sleep in the maid's bed
Y - O - U.
Where will the maid sleep?
The maid sleep, the maid sleep?,
Where will the maid sleep?
Y - O - U.
The maid will sleep in the pig-sty,
The pig-sty, the pig-sty,
The maid will sleep in the pig-sty
Y - O - U.
Where will the pig sleep?,
The pig sleep, the pig sleep?
Where will the pig sleep?
Y - O - U.
The pig will sleep at the riverside,
The riverside, the riverside,
The pig will sleep at the riverside
Y - O - U.
Where will you wash your clothes?
Wash your clothes, wash your clothes?
Where will you wash your clothes?
Y - O - U.

title: Jenny Jones, song
lyrics:
I've come to see Jenny Jones,
Jenny Jones, Jenny Jones,
I've come to see Jenny Jones.
You can't see her today.
For Jenny Jones' washing clothes,
Washing clothes, washing clothes,
Jenny Jones' washing clothes,
You can't see her today.
I've come to see Jenny Jones,
Jenny Jones, Jenny Jones,
I've come to see Jenny Jones.
You can't see her today.
For Jenny Jones' smoothing clothes,
Smoothing clothes, smoothing clothes,
Jenny Jones' smoothing clothes,
You can't see her today.
We've come to see Jenny Jones,
Jenny Jones, Jenny Jones,
We've come to see Jenny Jones.
You can't see her today.
For Jenny Jones' mending clothes,
Mending clothes, mending clothes,
Jenny Jones' mending clothes,
You can't see her today.
We've come to see Jenny Jones
Jenny Jones, Jenny Jones,
We've come to see Jenny Jones.
You can't see her today.
For Jenny Jones' ill in bed,
Ill in bed, ill in bed,
Jenny Jones' ill in bed,
You can't see her today.
We've come to see Jenny Jones,
Jenny Jones, Jenny Jones,
We've come to see Jenny Jones
You can't see her today.
For Jenny Jones' dead and gone,
Dead and gone, dead and gone,
Jenny Jones' dead and gone,
You can't see her today.

title: One, two, three, O'Leary, song [Belfast]
lyrics:
One, two three, alery,
Four, five, six, alery,
Seven, eight, nine, alery,
Ten, alery,
Post-boy's knock.

title: On the mountain stands a lady, song
lyrics:
On the mountain stands a lady,
Who she is I do not know.
She has lost her gold and silver,
All she wants is someone new.
Call in my Rosemary oh,
Rosemary oh,
Call in my Rosemary oh,
Till I get out to play.

title: Hally go lee go lee, song
lyrics:
Hally go-lee go lee,
Hally go-lo go-lo,
Hally go-lee go lee,
Upon a summer's day, Yoh!
Hally go-lee go lee,
Hally go-lo go-lo,
Hally go-lee go lee,
Upon a summer's day.
Here we go round the ring,
Hally go-lee go-lo,
Hally go-lee go lee,
Upon a summer's day.

title: Here are the robbers coming through, song
lyrics:
Here are the robbers coming through,
Coming through, coming through, 
Here are the robbers coming through, 
My fair lady. 
What did the robbers do on you, 
Do on you, do on you? 
What did the robbers do on you 
My fair lady? 
They stole my watch and broke my chain,
Broke my chain, broke my chain,
They stole my watch and broke my chain, 
My fair lady. 
Up to jail you must go, 
You must go, you must go,
Up to jail you must go, my fair lady

title: In and out the windows, song
lyrics:
In and out the windows,
In and out the windows,
In and out the windows,
As you have done before.
Stand and face your partner,
Stand and face your partner,
Stand and face your partner,
As you have done before.
In and out the windows,
In and out the windows,
In and out the windows,
As you have done before.
Turn and kiss your partner,
Turn and kiss your partner
Turn and kiss your partner
As you have done before.

title: Green gravel, song
lyrics:
Green gravel, green gravel,
Your grass is so green,
You're the fairest young damsel,
That ever I've seen.
I washed her, I dressed her,
I robed her in silk,
And I wrote down her name,
With a glass pen and ink.
Dear Eileen, dear Eileen,
Your true love is dead,
And I sent you a letter,
To turn back your head.
Green gravel, green gravel,
Your grass is so green,
You're the fairest young damsel,
That ever I've seen.

title: I'm a little Dutch girl, song
lyrics:
Oh I'm a little Dutch girl,
A Dutch girl, a Dutch girl,
Oh I'm a little Dutch girl
From over the sea.
Oh, I'm a little Dutch boy,
A Dutch boy, a Dutch boy,
Oh, I'm a little Dutch boy
From over the sea.
Oh, go 'way, I hate you,
I hate you, I hate you,
Oh, go 'way, I hate you,
From over the sea.
Oh why do you hate me,
Hate me, hate me?
Oh why do you hate me
From over the sea?
Because you hit my sister,
My sister, my sister,
Because you hit my sister
From over the sea.
Oh please will you forgive me,
Forgive me, forgive me?
Oh please will you forgive me
From over the sea?
Oh yes, I will forgive you,
Forgive you, forgive you,
Oh yes, I will forgive you,
From over the sea
Oh now we are together,
Together, together,
Oh now we are together
From over the sea
Oh now we are married,
Married, married,
Oh now we're getting married
From over the sea.

title: Chase, chase, chase the hairy elephant, song
lyrics:
Chase, chase, chase the hairy elephant,
Whoever told a lie on baldy Deborah!
That was on baldy Kitty.
Chase, chase, chase the hairy elephant,
Whoever told a lie on baldy Mary!
That was on baldy Deborah.
hase, chase, chase the hairy elephant,
Whoever told a lie on baldy Kitty!
That was on baldy Mary.
Chase, chase, chase the hairy elephant,
Whoever told a lie on baldy Mary!
That was on baldy Deborah.

title: The walls of Jerusalem, song
lyrics:
Oh, the poor man lived outside the walls of Jerusalem,
Glory, Hallelujah, hi-oh jerrum.
The rich man lived inside the walls of Jerusalem,
Glory, Hallelujah, hi-oh jerrum.
The poor man went to the rich man's door-ium,
Glory, Hallelujah, hi-oh jerrum.
The poor man asked for a breadie and a cheese-ium,
Glory, Hallelujah, hi-oh jerrum.
The rich man said I'll call the police-ium.
Glory, Hallelujah, hi-oh jerrum.
Hi-oh jerrum, hi-oh jerrum
Skiddle a mink a doodle um, skiddle a mink a doodle um,
Glory, Hallelujah, hi-oh jerrum.
Now the poor man died and he went straight to heaven-ium
Glory, Hallelujah, hi-oh jerrum.
He was fooling with the angels at a quarter past eleven-ium
Glory, Hallelujah, hi-oh jerrum.
Hi-oh jerrum,
Hi-oh jerrum,
Skiddle a mink a doodle um,
Skiddle a mink a doodle um,
Glory, Hallelujah, hi-oh jerrum.
Now the rich man died and he didn't fare so well-ium
Glory, Hallelujah, hi-oh jerrum.
He couldn't go to heaven, so he had to go to hell-ium
Glory, Hallelujah, hi-oh jerrum.
Now the rich man asked for a whiskey and a sod-ium
Glory, Hallelujah, hi-oh jerrum.
The devil only shouted, Shovel on the coal-ium.
Glory, Hallelujah, hi-oh jerrum.
Hi-oh jerrum,
Hi-oh jerrum,
Skiddle a mink a doodle um,
Skiddle a mink a doodle um,
Glory, Hallelujah, hi-oh jerrum.
Now the moral of my story is, the richie and the poor-ium
Glory, Hallelujah, hi-oh jerrum.
We're all stony broke, so we'll all go to heaven-ium
Glory, Hallelujah, hi-oh jerrum.
Hi-oh jerrum,
Hi-oh jerrum,
Skiddle a mink a doodle um,
Skiddle a mink a doodle um,
Glory, Hallelujah, hi-oh jerrum.

title: My Mother Told Me [A Naughty Girl], song
lyrics:
My mother told me
If I was goodie
That she would buy me
A rubber dollie.
My auntie told her
I kissed a soldier
And now she won't buy me
A rubber dollie.

title: I'm the wee faloorie man, song
lyrics:
I'm the wee faloorie man,
Faloorie man, faloorie man,
I'm the wee faloorie man,
Come catch me if you can.
Bw - w - w!

title: In the alley
lyrics:
Down in the alley where the green grass grows
See Raymond ******* washing his clothes.
He sings, he sings, he sings so sweet,
He calls for Ann ******* down the street.
Ann, Ann, will you marry me?
Yes, dear, yes, dear, at half past three.
Ice cakes, jam cakes, all for tea
And we'll have a jolly wedding at half past three.

title: My aunt Jane she called me in, song
lyrics:
My aunt Jane she called me in,
She made me tea in her wee tin,
A penny bap,
Sugar on the top,
Three black balls out of her wee shop.
My aunt Jane she called me in,
She made me tea in her black tin.
She called me back, I wouldn't go,
She shut the door on my wee toe.

title: Chewing gum a penny a packet, song
lyrics:
Chewing-gum a penny a packet,
First you chew it, then you crack it,
Then you stick it to your jacket,
Chewing-gum a penny a packet.

title: Our Queen up the river, song
lyrics:
Our Queen up the river
With your yah! yah! yah!
Our Queen up the river
With your yah! yah! yah!
Our Queen up the river
And she'll be up there for ever
With your yah! yah!
Yah! yah! yah!

title: Our Queen can burl her leg, song
lyrics:
Our Queen can burl her leg,
Burl her leg, burl her leg,
Our Queen can burl her leg,
Burl her leg.

title: Our Queen won, song
lyrics:
Our Queen won,
our Queen won,
Yee-oh, bravo,
our Queen won.
The other had to run,
the other had to run,
Yee-oh, bravo,
our Queen won.

title: Raddy addy and we're not beat yet, song
lyrics:
Raddy addy and we're not beat yet,
Raddy addy and we're not beat yet,
Raddy addy and we're not beat yet,
We're not beat yet and we're hardly.

title: Here she sits, a lovely creature, song
lyrics:
Here she sits a lovely creature,
Who she is I cannot tell;
I will court her for her beauty,
All I want's a nice young girl,
To be the Queen of May,
To be the Queen of May,
The darkie says he'll marry her,
He'll marry her, he'll marry her
The darkie says he'll marry her,
Because she is a Queen.
Because she is a Queen,
Because she is a Queen,
The darkie says he'll marry her
He'll marry her, he'll marry her,
The darkie says he'll marry her
Because she is a Queen.

title: Grandma Gray, rhyme
lyrics:
Grandma, grandma Gray,
Will you let us out to play?
We'll not go near the water
To chase the ducks away.
No, dear children,
it's a very wet day.
Grandma, grandma Gray,
Will you let us out to play?
We'll not go near the water
To chase the ducks away.
Yes, dear children,
it's a very fine day.

title: We'll join our hands together [Fermanagh mummers], song
lyrics:
We'll join our hands together
And never fight no more,
We'll be as gallant comrades
As we have been before,
We'll bless the master of this house
And the mistress too
And all the little children
That round the table grew.
With our pockets full of money
And our hearts all full of cheer
We wish you a merry Christmas
And a bright New Year!

title: Here's to you Tom Brown [Fermanagh mummers], song
lyrics:
The twelve beats the eleven and the eleven beats the ten,
We are a jolly company of stout, strong men;
Here's to you, Tom Brown, here's to you with all my heart,
We'll have another glass or two this night before we part,
Here's to you, Tom Brown.
The ten beats the nine and the nine beats the eight,
We are a jolly company, we all walk straight;
Here's to you, Tom Brown, here's to you with all my heart,
We'll have another glass or two this night before we part, 
Here's to you, Tom Brown.
The nine beats the eight and the eight beats the seven,
We are a jolly company and we're going to heaven
Here's to you, Tom Brown, here's to you with all my heart,
We'll have another glass or two this night before we part, 
Here's to you, Tom Brown.
The seven beats the six and the six beats the five,
We are a jolly company, we are, man alive!
Here's to you, Tom Brown, here's to you with all my heart,
We'll have another glass or two this night before we part, 
Here's to you, Tom Brown.
The five beats the four and the four beats the three, We are a jolly company and we're all free
Here's to you, Tom Brown, here's to you with all my heart,
We'll have another glass or two this night before we part, 
Here's to you, Tom Brown.
The three beats the two and the two beats the one,
We are a jolly company and now we're done
Here's to you, Tom Brown, here's to you with all my heart,
We'll have another glass or two this night before we part, 
Here's to you, Tom Brown.

title: God bless the master of this house [Donegal mummers], song
lyrics:
God bless the master of this house
And the landlady also
And all the little children around the table go,
For we wish you a happy New Year, Year, Year,
Ay, we wish you a happy New Year.
With our pockets full of money
And your barrels full of beer
Well, we wish you a happy New Year, Year, Year,
Ay, we wish you a happy New Year

title: Rocking the cradle, song
lyrics:
Oh it's rocking the cradle,
It's rocking the cradle,
It's rocking the cradle
And it's singing Hee ba.
La deedle dee dee dee dee
Deedle dee dee dee
Och it's rocking the cradle
And singing Hee ba.

title: You're a wee bonny wean, song
lyrics:
You're a wee bonny wean,
You're a wee bonny wean,
You're a wee bonny wee wean,
You're a wee bonny wee wean.

title: Minnie Picken on the shore, song
lyrics:
Minnie Picken on the shore.
Gathering winkles off Culmore,
Turned around and give a roar:
- What the divil ails ye?
A-ring deedle lil de dum
Dithery dum de doodle um
Ring deedle lil de dum
Doodle lil de da dee
A-ring deedle lil de dum
Dithery dum de doodle um
Ring deedle lil de dum
Doodle lil de da dee
Jane McNeill's in love with me
And I'm as happy as I can be.
How would you like if you were me?
Fal de deedle di do.
Jane she's neat and Jane she's fat,
She wears her hair beneath her hat;
What do you think about that?
Fal de deedle di do.
A-ring deedle lil de dum
Dithery dum de doodle um
Ring deedle lil de dum
Doodle lil de da dee
A-ring deedle lil de dum
Dithery dum de doodle um
Ring deedle lil de dum
Fal de deedle di do.

title: Love will you marry me?, song
lyrics:
Love, will you marry me,
Marry me, marry me,
Love, will you marry me,
And take me out of danger?
This is the way the teacher stands,
This is the way she holds her hands,
This is the way she combs her hair,
And this is the way she dances.
Dy deedle oodle um
Dithery aydle oodle um
Da rowdle doodle dee,
Doodle diddle doo dum,
Dy deedle oodle um
Dithery aydle oodle um
Da rowdle doodle dee,
Doodle diddle doo dum.

title: When I was young I had no sense, song
lyrics:
When I was young I had no sense,
I bought a fiddle for eighteen pence
And all the tunes that I could play
Was O'er the hill and far away.

title: I love my love far better, song
lyrics:
As I roved out one fine summer's night
For to look for recreation
My heart was light and free from care,
Quite happy in my station;
Down by a transparent river clear
I met a comely maiden there
With a garland of flowers on her head she did wear
For to shade the sun from her beauty.
You gods, oh gods of this divine,
Come hand my love a letter,
That gave to me this mortal wound,
No one could love her better.
Far more than fishes likes to swim,
Far more than linnets likes to sing,
Far better than the bee loves the flowery vale
I love my love far better.

title: The dark-eyed gipsy, song
lyrics:
There was three gipsies lived in the East:
They sang so sweet and bonny, oh,
They sang so sweet, so very sweet,
They charmed the heart of the lady, oh.
When Charles he came home late at night
Enquiring for his lady, oh,
She's gone, she's gone, said his own waiting-man,
She has followed the dark-eyed gipsy, oh.
[Then saddle me my milk-white steed -
The brown one's not so speedy, oh -
That I may ride the whole length of the night
Till I find out the dark-eyed gipsy, oh.]
Then he rode North and he rode South,
He rode East and Westwards, oh,
Until he met with his own wedded wife,
And she following the dark-eyed gipsy, oh.
Will you forsake your house and land?
Will you forsake your children, oh?
Will you forsake your own wedded lord
And follow the dark-eyed gipsy, oh?
What do I care for house and land?
What do I care for my children, oh?
What do I care for my own wedded lord
When I followed the dark-eyed gipsy, oh!
She took the garment that she wore,
She bound it as a head-dress, oh,
Saying I'll eat the grass, I'll drink the dew
And follow the dark-eyed gipsy, oh.

title: The maid of Culmore, song
lyrics:
From fair Londonderry to sweet London town
There is no better harbour around can be found,
Where the young girl each evening does walk round the shore And the joy-bells were ringing the maid of Coolmore.
The first time I saw my love she passed me by
And the next time I saw her she bid me goodbye,
But the last time I saw her she grieved my heart sore
As she sailed down Lough Foyle and away from Coolmore.

title: B'fhearr liom réal beag, song
lyrics:
B'fhearr liom réal beag,
Réal beag deas.
B'fhearr liom réal beag
Ná rud a bhíos sa domhan.
Chaith mé réal beag,
Réal beag deas,
Agus thug mé réal
Abhaile chuig mo mhnaoi

title: Obadiah, song
lyrics:
Says the one Obadiah to the tother Obadiah,
Obadiah, Obadiah, I am dry!
Says the tother Obadiah to the first Obadiah,
Obadiah, Obadiah, so am I!

title: John Barbour, song
lyrics:
There was a lord lived in this town,
He had only one loved daughter Jane;
And as she stood in her father's castle walls
She was watching the ship sails on, on,
She was watching the ship sails on.
What ails you, what ails you? her father did say,
You look so pale and wan;
Nor have you got some sore sickness, he says,
Nor deceived by some young man, man,
Nor deceived by some young man.
I have not got sore nor sickness, she says,
Nor deceived by no young man,
But the truth unto you, my father, I will tell:
My true love stops too long, long,
My true love stops too long.
Is your true love a knight nor a lord, he says,
Nor is he a man of fame,
Nor is he one of our seamen bold
That ploughs the raging main, main?
That ploughs the raging main.
He is not a knight nor a lord, she says,
Nor he is not a man of fame
But he is one of our seamen bold:
John Barbour is his name, name,
John Barbour is his name.
If that is so, dear daughter, he says,
That you fell in love with he,
But before eight o'clock on tomorrow morning
I will hang him to a tree, tree,
I will hang him to a tree.
If you'll hang John Barbour, dear father, she says
And hang him to a tree,
But before eight o'clock on tomorrow morning
I will die as well as he, he,
I will die as well as he
Then he called all his merry men in
By one, by two and by three,
And the very man that always used to come first
Was the very last man came he, he,
the very last man came he.
His stockings they were of the grass-green silk
And his coat of the navy blue
And his skin was as white as any milk
That ever your eyes had seen, seen,
That ever your eyes had seen.
It's no wonder now, dear daughter, he says
That you fell in love with he
For if I was a woman nor though I am a man
My bedfellow he would be, be
My bedfellow he would be
Will you marry my daughter now, he said
With the faith of my own right hand?
She can eat and drink at my own table
And be heir of all my land, land,
And be heir of all my land
I will marry your daughter now, he said
With the faith of my own right hand.
She can eat and drink at my own table
And a fig for all your land, land,
And a fig for all your land.
For now John Barbour it is my name
And a seaman to you I only stand,
For I've just got as good living as you
I'm the mayor of all Creveland, land
I'm the mayor of all Creveland
He mounted his love on a milk-white steed
And they rode unto a bay
And they have as much land as you could walk round
For the length of a long summer's day!

title: The Kerry recruit, song
lyrics:
When I was in Ireland and digging up land
With me brogues on me feet and me spade in me hand,
Oh, up came a sergeant, said he, Would you list?
Arrah, grá mo chroí, sergeant, gi' me a hould of your fist,,
Singing, Taddy hi ho, taddy hi ho,
Wack fal de doodle, Taddy hi ho.
He gave me five bob, he said he'd give me more;
Call up to headquarters, I'll pay off your score. Headquarters, headquarters, headquarters, says I,
If I'm going to be quartered, sir I'll bid you good-bye, Singing, Taddy hi ho, taddy hi ho,
Wack fal de doodle, singing Taddy hi ho.
When I listed to sea I was sent
On board a big ship called the Bonny Dundee
Three sticks in the middle all covered with a sheet
And she walked along the water without any feet!
Singing, Taddy hi ho, taddy hi ho,
Wack fal de doodle, singing Taddy hi ho.
And when I was listed to India I was sent,
With climbing up rocks my knees were all bent;
I listed for seven, thank God it's not ten
I'll go home to old Ireland and I'll dig turf again
Singing, Taddy hi ho, taddy hi ho,
Wack fal de doodle, singing Taddy hi ho.

title: My love she's but a lassie, song
lyrics:
Oh, my love she's but a lassie, oh,
A lassie, oh, a lassie, oh;
I will let her stand a year or two
And she'll not be half as saucy, oh.
For I kissed her once, she never said, No
And then I kissed her twice my love to show
And she says, Your whiskers tickles me so!
Keep on doing it, Sandy, oh!

title: Did you ever see the devil and his wooden leg and shovel, song
lyrics:
Did you ever see the divil and his wooden leg and shovel
Digging taties in the garden and his tail cocked up?
Did you ever see the divil and his wooden leg and shovel
Digging taties in the garden and his tail cocked up?

title: Some say the divil's dead, song
lyrics:
Some says the divil's dead,
Some says he's hardly.
Some says the divil's dead
And buried in Killarney.

title: Wee Magee and a half-a-dozen more, song
lyrics:
Wee Magee and a half-a-dozen more
Were lying on the sawdust and the sawdust on the floor
There was such a gathering crowd that we'd never seen before.
Wee Magee and a half-a-dozen more.

title: For my daddy goes to meeting, song
lyrics:
For my daddy goes to Meeting And my mammy goes to Mass
And I take a rattle At the Cuckoo's nest.

title: My love wears the tarry trousers, song
lyrics:
My love wears the tarry trousers,
My love wears the jacket blue,
My love sails on another ocean,
So, young man, away with you.
Why do you die so much on beauty?
It's a flower that'll soon decay.
Like the rose that blooms in summer
When winter comes it dies away.

title: I'll climb up a high high tree, song
lyrics:
I'll climb up a high, high tree
And I'll rob a rich bird's nest
And I'll come down without a frown
And I'll wed the one that I love best.
For T it stands for Tom, my dear,
And J for my love John
And W stands for sweet William
For he is the fairest one.

title: On the top of yon heathery mountain, song
lyrics:
On the top of yon heathery mountain
I would rather be with you
As any duke or squire
Or lord of a high degree.

title: The tree in the ground, song
lyrics:
In yonder ground there was a tree,
As fine a tree as ever was seen,
For the tree in the ground
And the green grass grew all round, all round,
And the green grass grew all round.
And on that tree there was a stump,
As fine a stump as ever was seen,
For the stump on the tree,
And the tree in the ground
And the green grass grew all round, all round,
And the green grass grew all round.
And on that tree there was a branch,
As fine a branch as ever was seen,
For the branch on the tree,
And the tree in the ground
And the green grass grew all round, all round,
And the green grass grew all round.
And on that branch there was a twig,
As fine a twig as ever was seen,
For the twig on the tree,
And the branch on the tree,
And the tree in the ground
And the green grass grew all round, all round,
And the green grass grew all round.
And on that twig there was a nest,
As fine a nest as ever was seen,
For the nest on the twig,
And the twig on the tree,
And the branch on the tree,
And the tree in the ground
And the green grass grew all round, all round,
And the green grass grew all round. 
And in that nest there was an egg,
As fine a egg as ever was seen,
For the egg on the nest,
And the nest on the twig,
And the twig on the tree,
And the branch on the tree,
And the tree in the ground
And the green grass grew all round, all round,
And the green grass grew all round. 
And in that egg there was a bird,
As fine a bird as ever was seen,
For the bird in the egg,
And the egg in the nest,
And the nest on the twig,
And the twig on the branch,
And the branch on the stump,
And the stump on the tree,
And the tree in the ground,
And the green grass grew all round, all round,
And the green grass grew all round.

title: It's of a row to you I'll show, song
lyrics:
It's of a row to you I'll show
Down in the kitchen here below.
To tell you the truth what begun the fray:
The broom stood in the dishcloth's way.
The dishcloth said it was not fair
And told the broom to not stand there.
The tongs got up by the fireside,
Got up on their long legs and cried.
And called to the broom to quieten down
Or he would have to leave the room.
The dishcloth then began to wash
And through the water it did splash.

title: To my grief and woe I'll let you know, song
lyrics:
To my grief and woe I'll let you know
That I'm a poor land-holder
And Nancy Margit's my wife's name:
She's a teaser of a scolder.
I sung, Ay sure ay sure, all diddle ay, To my right shill er ill ay do.
I hadn't been long cutting ash in a wood
Till I heard the roar of a donkey
And looking round I was tight-l-y hugged
between two rank-tailed monkeys.
I sung, Ay sure ay sure, all diddle ay, To my right shill er ill ay do.
O they dragged me here and they dragged me there
And they dragged me to a river;
Between dooking and diving I got rid
I think I done right clever.
I sung, Ay sure ay sure, all diddle ay, To my right shill er ill ay do.

title: The Inniskilling dragoon, song
lyrics:
There was a fair lady lived in Monaghan town,
A rich merchant's daughter of fame and renown;
As she strayed by the barracks this beautiful maid
She watched from her carriage the dragoons on parade.
Fare you well, Enniskillen, fare you well for a while
And all around the borders of Erin's green isle
And when the war is over we'll return in full bloom
And we will all welcome home our Inniskilling dragoon.
The dragoons they were dressed up like gentlemen's sons With their bright, shining swords and their carabine guns; Their silver-mounted pistols she observed them full soon All because that she loved her Inniskilling dragoon.
Fare you well, Enniskillen, fare you well for a while
And all around the borders of Erin's green isle
And when the war is over we'll return in full bloom
And we'll all welcome home our Inniskilling dragoon.
Oh mother, dear mother, for me do not weep;
My mother's kind advice I am going for to keep.
My parents brought me up from a boy unto a man
And I'm going in defence of my own native land.
Fare you well, Enniskillen, fare you well for a while,
And all around the borders of Erin's green isle,
And when the war is over we'll return in full bloom,
And we will all welcome home our Inniskilling dragoon.

title: Twas pretty to be in Ballinderry, song
lyrics:
'Twas pretty to be in Ballinderry,
'Twas pretty to be in Aghalee,
'Twas pretty to be in little Ram's island
In trysting under the ivy tree.
Ochone, ochone, ochone, ochone.
'Twas pretty to be in Ballinderry,
But now it's sad as sad can be,
For the ship that sailed with Phelim my lover
Is sunk forever beneath the sea.
Ochone, ochone, ochone, ochone.
And oh, that I wear the weeping willow
To wander alone by the lonesome billow
And cry to him over the cruel sea,
Oh Phelim, my lover, come back to me.
Ochone, ochone, ochone, ochone.
